element.name: prov:id
element.label: ID
element.description: Must be in the form of an XML Qualified Name eg. gnprov:dataset1 - must also be unique. Note qualified names have an optional prefix (in front of the :) and a name part (after the :). The prefix and name parts must start with a letter and be alphanumeric.

element.name: prov:ref
element.label: Reference to ID
element.description: Must be a reference to an ID in the form of an XML Qualified Name eg. gnprov:dataset1 - must also be unique. Note qualified names have an optional prefix (in front of the :) and a name part (after the :). The prefix and name parts must start with a letter and be alphanumeric.

element.name: prov:label
element.label: Label
element.description: The label is a human-readable representation of an instance of a PROV-DM type or relation.

element.name: prov:location
element.label: Location
element.description: A location can be an identifiable geographic place (ISO 19112), but it can also be a non-geographic place such as a directory, row, or column.

element.name: prov:type
element.label: Type
element.description: The type provides further typing information for any construct with an optional set of attribute-value pairs.

element.name: prov:value
element.label: Value
element.description: The value is a direct representation of an entity as a PROV-DM Value.

element.name: prov:role
element.label: Role
element.description: A role is the function of an entity or agent with respect to an activity, in the context of a usage, generation, invalidation, association, start, and end.

element.name: prov:startTime
element.label: Start Time
element.description: Start time for an activity.

element.name: prov:endTime
element.label: End Time
element.description: End time for an activity.

element.name: prov:time
element.label: Time
element.description: Time stamp.

element.name: prov:entity
element.label: Entity
element.description: An entity is a physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects; entities may be real or imaginary. In this implementation: an entity is a parameter for an OGC Web Processing Service to consume or the output of an OGC Web Processing Service. If the parameter is a dataset and a metadata record exists for that dataset then the prov:id of the entity will be set to the uuid of that metadata record.

element.name: prov:activity
element.label: Activity
element.description: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities. In this implementation, the prov:id attribute can be set to the uuid of a metadata record describing the activity (usually with metadataScopeCode set to project)

element.name: prov:wasGeneratedBy
element.label: Was Generated By
element.description: Describes the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.

element.name: prov:used
element.label: Used
element.description: Describes the usage of an entity by an activity. Before usage, the activity had not begun to utilize this entity and could not have been affected by the entity.

element.name: prov:wasInformedBy
element.label: Was Informed By
element.description: Describes how an activity uses an entity generated by a different activity.

element.name: prov:wasStartedBy
element.label: Was Started By
element.description: Describes when an activity is started by an entity known as trigger. The activity did not exist before its start. Any usage, generation, or invalidation involving an activity follows the activity's start. A start may refer to a trigger entity that set off the activity, or to an activity, known as starter, that generated the trigger. In this implementation a trigger entity could be a command to submit a collection of entities to an OGC Web Processing Service.

element.name: prov:wasEndedBy
element.label: Was Ended By
element.description: Describes when an activity is ended by an entity known as trigger. The activity no longer exists after its end. Any usage, generation, or invalidation involving an activity precedes the activity's end. An end may refer to a trigger entity that terminated the activity, or to an activity, known as ender that generated the trigger.

element.name: prov:wasInvalidatedBy
element.label: Was Invalidated By
element.description: Invalidation is the start of the destruction, cessation, or expiry of an existing entity by an activity. The entity is no longer available for use (or further invalidation) after invalidation. Any generation or usage of an entity precedes its invalidation.

element.name: prov:wasDerivedFrom
element.label: Was Derived From
element.description: A derivation is a transformation of an entity into another, an update of an entity resulting in a new one, or the construction of a new entity based on a pre-existing entity.

element.name: prov:wasRevisionOf
element.label: Was Revision Of
element.description: A revision is a derivation for which the resulting entity is a revised version of some original.

element.name: prov:wasQuotedFrom
element.label: Was Quoted From
element.description: A quotation is the repeat of (some or all of) an entity, such as text or image, by someone who may or may not be its original author.

element.name: prov:hadPrimarySource
element.label: Had Primary Source
element.description: A primary source for a topic refers to something produced by some agent with direct experience and knowledge about the topic, at the time of the topic's study, without benefit from hindsight.

element.name: prov:agent
element.label: Agent
element.description: An agent is something that bears some form of responsibility for an activity taking place, for the existence of an entity, or for another agent's activity. In this implementation: an agent has a prov:id which points to an ISO metadata fragment (eg. cit:CI_Organisation for ISO19115-1/-3)

element.name: prov:person
element.label: Person
element.description: Person agents are people. In this implementation: a person has a prov:id which points to an ISO metadata fragment (eg. cit:CI_Individual for ISO19115-1/-3)

element.name: prov:organization
element.label: Organisation
element.description: An organization is a social or legal institution such as a company, society, etc. In this implementation: an organization has a prov:id which points to an ISO metadata fragment (eg. cit:CI_Organisation for ISO19115-1/-3).

element.name: prov:softwareAgent
element.label: Software Agent
element.description: A software agent is running software. In this implementation: a software agent has a prov:id which points to a metadata record that describes an OGC web processing service (WPS).

element.name: prov:wasAttributedTo
element.label: Was Attributed To
element.description: Describes an attribution. Attribution is the ascribing of an entity to an agent.

element.name: prov:wasAssociatedWith
element.label: Was Associated With
element.description: An activity association is an assignment of responsibility to an agent for an activity, indicating that the agent had a role in the activity. It further allows for a plan to be specified, which is the plan intended by the agent to achieve some goals in the context of this activity.

element.name: prov:actedOnBehalfOf
element.label: Acted On Behalf Of
element.description: Describes a delegation. A delegation is the assignment of authority and responsibility to an agent (by itself or by another agent) to carry out a specific activity as a delegate or representative, while the agent it acts on behalf of retains some responsibility for the outcome of the delegated work.

element.name: prov:wasInfluencedBy
element.label: Was Influenced By
element.description: Describes influence. Influence is the capacity of an entity, activity, or agent to have an effect on the character, development, or behavior of another by means of usage, start, end, generation, invalidation, communication, derivation, attribution, association, or delegation.

element.name: prov:delegate
element.label: Delegated Agent
element.description: Delegated agent reference.

element.name: prov:responsible
element.label: Responsible Agent
element.description: Responsible agent reference.

element.name: prov:bundle
element.label: Bundle
element.description: A bundle is a named set of provenance descriptions, and is itself an ENTITY, so allowing provenance of provenance to be expressed.

element.name: prov:specializationOf
element.label: Specialization Of
element.description: An ENTITY that is a specialization of another shares all aspects of the latter, and additionally presents more specific aspects of the same thing as the latter. In particular, the lifetime of the entity being specialized contains that of any specialization.

element.name: prov:alternateOf
element.label: Alternate Of
element.description: Two alternate entities present aspects of the same thing. These aspects may be the same or different, and the alternate entities may or may not overlap in time.

element.name: prov:collection
element.label: Collection
element.description: A collection is an entity that provides a structure to some constituents that must themselves be entities. These constituents are said to be member of the collections.

element.name: prov:emptyCollection
element.label: Empty Collection
element.description: An empty collection is a collection without members.

element.name: prov:plan
element.label: Plan
element.description: A plan is an entity that represents a set of actions or steps intended by one or more agents to achieve some goals.

element.name: prov:other
element.label: Document Metadata
element.description: A block of elements that hold basic discovery metadata about the provenance document.

element.name: dct:modified
element.label: Date Modified
element.description: Modification date of the provenance document.

element.name: dct:created
element.label: Date Created
element.description: Creation date of the provenance document.

element.name: dc:title
element.label: Title
element.description: Title of the provenance document.

element.name: dc:description
element.label: Abstract
element.description: Description of the provenance document.

element.name: dc:identifier
element.label: Identifier
element.description: Identifier of the provenance document.

element.name: dc:coverage
element.label: Bounding Box
element.description: Bounding box of the provenance document.

element.name: dc:subject
element.label: Keywords
element.description: Keywords that describe the provenance document.
